meanings.definition: A person or thing that precedes the coming or development of someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The forerunners of modern technology paved the way for our current advancements.
meanings.sent2: The forerunners of spring, the crocuses, bloomed early this year.
meanings.sent3: The forerunners of the party, the early birds, arrived before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: The forerunners of success are often hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The forerunners of change can be seen in the shifting attitudes of the youth.

meanings.definition: A predecessor in a particular office or position.
meanings.sent1: The forerunners of the CEO were respected leaders in the company.
meanings.sent2: The forerunners of the current president set a high standard for leadership.
meanings.sent3: The forerunners of the team captain were known for their exceptional skills.
meanings.sent4: The forerunners of the principal were dedicated educators who left a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The forerunners of the mayor were beloved figures in the community.
